column4: can someone tell me how to set up my public directory in samba or atleast point an article

try 'locate Zend' to see where its at.
locate updates the locate database about once a day. as a cron job.
thats why its so fast at finding things.. but not always up to date
wine shows them as instaslled where exactly?
how is wine showing that.
from the start menu wine>programs and list me some programs installed
thats not 'wine' showing anything.   when a wine app installs.. the process gernates a .destktop and other files that gnome menus use. :)
i think they are stored in ~/.config/menus/applications-merged
but i start wine>Uninstall wine software it shows me tthat programs
and list them in the add/remove programs window
I tend to just purge my whole .wine dir every so often. :) i rarely fight with wine much.
i rarely even mess with th extra things in the wine 'menu' either.
select the classic desktop at the GDM login screen if you want the old 'classic' gnome desktop.
how is called this thing to see options for it
when you log out.  you enter your user name. then theres a menu at the bottom. select 'classic'
i was asking for the horizontal thing
and its not clear what you are asking about. You mean the top panel thats always been in gnome? or the left side panel - thats the new unity launcher thing..
you really dont tweak unity much at this time.
unity launcher thing thanks

not sure what you mean. You want the preferances tool? its under a menu item under the power button now.
